availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Owsley (Larue County, Kentucky, store clerk)

body.p: Larue County, Kentucky, store clerk. Larue County, Kentucky native. Son of B. W. Owsley and Alice Morrison Owsley. Resident of LaRue County, Kentucky, in 1850. Store clerk in the mercantile of S. J. LaRue in LaRue County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, Hamiltons, p. 403. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, p. 145. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Sonora, p. 7. Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), Hardin County, 1912, no. 30502, Microfilm rolls #7016130-7041803, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky.
